column2: More employers are saying that workers can now stay home for months longer, while some pause vaccine requirements as the Biden administration’s directive is blocked.
column3: Business/The Wall Street Journal•2 days ago
column4: Companies Upend Plans on Covid-19 Vaccines and Office Returns, Again

column2: Don't stray too far from the beaten path, Jim Cramer told his Mad Money viewers Monday. Typically, a market that rallies on the backs of just a handful of stocks is a bad thing. Over on Action Alerts PLUS, Chris Versace and Bob Lang are adding shares of Airbnb and Applied Materials to the portfolio. You want stocks that trade on earnings, not future sales.
column4: Cramer's Mad Money Recap 12/13: Bank of America, Ford, Pfizer

column2: The e-signature company thrived during the pandemic, but it missed signs of a slowdown as the pandemic faded and absorbed the biggest blow in its history. Two big stock buys triggered a rebound.
column4: DocuSign Took a Vicious Hit. Bargain Hunters Helped the Stock Bounce Back.
